intro: Palicourea lucidula, commonly known as the glossy palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
